info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 8:56PM CDT until April 6 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Glover River At Glover affecting McCurtain County.
For the Glover River...including Glover...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Glover River at Glover.
* WHEN...Until Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor to moderate flooding will take place on the Glover River west of Glover, Oklahoma and especially at its confluence with the Little River west of Golden, Oklahoma.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 20.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 09/11/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 900 PM CDT.
